did.abstract: An artificial collection of late 19th and early 20th century American and British materials relating to shorthand.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Although the exact provenance of the materials is unknown, the items were presumably purchased by library staff in the mid to late 20th century.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically. There are no series.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Materials in this collection represent the two primary approaches to shorthand writing: orthographic (an alternative to the traditional Latin alphabet) and phonetic (a phonetic variant of the Latin alphabet). These items were presumably acquired by University at Albany library staff to complement the library's collection of American and British literature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This artificial collection contains materials from late 19th and early 20th century America and Britain relating to shorthand. Materials include a British shorthand manual; a booklet on laws, rules, and information for shorthand reporters in the state of New York; the by-laws and constitution of the New England Shorthand Reporters' Association; and The Third Book of Phonetic Reading, a guide to English phonetic shorthand reading and writing. The last item is written a phonetic variant of the Latin alphabet.
